command.name: account_currencies
command.desc: Lists the currencies an account can send or receive.

argument.name: account
argument.desc: The ID of the account you are interested in.

result.name: receive_currencies
result.desc: Array of currencies this account is able to receive.

result.name: send_currencies
result.desc: Array of currencies this account is able to send.

command.name: account_info
command.desc: Returns information about the given account.

argument.name: account
argument.desc: The account you are interested in.

result.name: Balance
result.desc: The number of stellars this account holds, in microstellars.

result.name: Flags
result.desc: What account flags are set.

result.name: OwnerCount
result.desc: The number of offers and trust lines created by this account. Useful for calculating the account's reserve.

result.name: PreviousTxnID
result.desc: The Transaction ID of the last transaction sent by this account.

result.name: PreviousTxnLgrSeq
result.desc: The ledger sequence number this account's last transaction appeared in.

result.name: Sequence
result.desc: The current transaction sequence number of this account.

result.name: index
result.desc: The index in the ledger of this account entry.

command.name: account_lines
command.desc: Gets a list of all trust lines a particular account is a part of. A trust line is how credits are tracked in the Stellar network. A trust line has an account on either end, a currency , the amount each account trusts the other for in that currency, and a current balance.

argument.name: account
argument.desc: The account you are fetching the lines of. Account A.

argument.name: peer
argument.desc: The account ID of another account. If specified will only return the trust lines from Account A to this peer.

result.name: account
result.desc: The account on the other side of the trust line. Account B.

result.name: balance
result.desc: The current balance of credit between A and B. Balance is positive if A is holding IOUs from B.

result.name: currency
result.desc: The currency of the trust line.

result.name: limit
result.desc: How much account A trusts account B for.

result.name: limit_peer
result.desc: How much account B trusts account A for.

result.name: authorized
result.desc: This is present if the peer has authorized this account to hold its credit.

result.name: authorized_peer
result.desc: This is present if this account has authorized the peer to hold its credit.

command.name: account_offers
command.desc: Gets a list of all the offers this account has made.

argument.name: account
argument.desc: The account you are getting the offers of.

command.name: ping
command.desc: Command to test connectivity to stellard.

command.name: transaction_entry
command.desc: Get the details of a particular transaction from a hash and a ledger index. It is useful since it is usually faster since it only has to search one ledger. However, it only works if you already know that the ledger index of this confirmed transaction. To search all ledgers, use the tx command instead.

argument.name: tx_hash
argument.desc: The hash of the transaction you are interested in.

argument.name: ledger_index
argument.desc: Ledger index in which to search for the transaction. If you do not absolutely know it, use the tx command instead.

command.name: account_tx
command.desc: Get a list of transactions that affected this account.

argument.name: account
argument.desc: The account ID to fetch transactions from.

argument.name: ledger_index_min
argument.desc: The earliest ledger to fetch transactions from.

argument.name: ledger_index_max
argument.desc: The latest ledger to fetch transactions from. Set to -1 to use the current ledger as the maximum.

argument.name: binary
argument.desc: Returns the transaction in hex instead of JSON.

argument.name: forward
argument.desc: Returns the transactions in ascending order by ledger.

argument.name: limit
argument.desc: Limit the number of transactions stellard will send back to you. stellard is configured with its own limits so you may not receive as many transactions as you ask for. Set to -1 to use the limit set by stellard.

argument.name: marker
argument.desc: Can be used to resume previous query. Use 'marker' value returned in result of query you want resumed.

command.name: book_offers
command.desc: Returns the offers in a given orderbook. An orderbook is a particular currency/issuer on the buy side and a different currency/issuer on the sell side.

argument.name: taker_gets
argument.desc: The amount for the buy side. A value should not be specified in this amount object, as the buy side of an orderbook is simply a currency/issuer pair.

argument.name: taker_pays
argument.desc: The amount for the sell side. A value should not be specified in this amount object, as the sell side of an orderbook is simply a currency/issuer pair.

argument.name: taker
argument.desc: If specified will show the orderbook from the point of view of the taker.

argument.name: marker
argument.desc: Token indicating start of page, it is returned from a previous call.

result.name: hash
result.desc: The hash of the submitted transaction.

result.name: marker
result.desc: Used for subsequent calls to page through the results. Not returned if there are no more results.

result.name: offers
result.desc: The offers sorted from best to worst.

command.name: create_keys
command.desc: Generates public/private key pair for use as a Stellar account.

argument.name: passphrase
argument.desc: If specified it will create the secret key from a hash of the passphrase.

result.name: account_id
result.desc: The generated accountID. It will become a usable stellar account if someone sends stellars to it.

result.name: master_seed
result.desc: The secret key in base58 format that corresponds to the accountID.

result.name: master_seed_hex
result.desc: The secret key in hex format that corresponds to the accountID.

result.name: public_key
result.desc: The public key in base58 format that corresponds to the accountID.

result.name: public_key_hex
result.desc: The public key in hex format that corresponds to the accountID.

command.name: ledger
command.desc: Gets info about a particular ledger.

argument.name: full
argument.desc: Return all the ledger entries. This is equivalent to setting accounts, transactions, and expand all to true. stellard can be configured to support this or not.

argument.name: accounts
argument.desc: If set to true, it will return the accounts tree for that public ledger block.

argument.name: transactions
argument.desc: If true, return the transactions for the ledger.

argument.name: expand
argument.desc: If set to true, returns the ledger and transaction entries in JSON format. Otherwise, returns their identifying hashes.

command.name: find_path
command.desc: Finds the best path for a transfer. Stellard will continue to send updates as it finds better paths or as the state of the ledger changes until find_path is called again with the close subcommand. A websocket connection may only have one open pathfinding request. If stellard responds because of a client query the response will have a field type set to response. If stellard is sending an unsolicited response the type field will be set to find_path. This command is only available via the Websocket API. If you want to use as RPC or command line or you don't want ongoing path updates use static_path_find instead.

argument.name: subcommand
argument.desc:
subcommand can be either
  • create
  • status
  • close

argument.name: source_account
argument.desc: Sender's Stellar address.

argument.name: destination_account
argument.desc: Receiver's Stellar address.

argument.name: destination_amount
argument.desc: Amount sender is trying to send to receiver.

result.name: alternatives
result.desc: Each entry will correspond to one possible source currency.

command.rpc_example: find_path only available over websocket. Consider using static_path_find

command.name: sign
command.desc: Have stellard sign a transaction for you. You can introduce the transaction later with submit by just including the tx_blob.

argument.name: tx_json
argument.desc:
This is the JSON representation of the transaction for server to sign with the private key of the secret.
If Sequence or Fee are not filled out then stellard will fill them in for if you.

argument.name: secret
argument.desc: The base58 encoded secret key of the signer.

argument.name: offline
argument.desc: If true stellard won't attempt to verify that the transaction is valid it will just sign it for you.

result.name: hash
result.desc: The hash of the submitted transaction.

result.name: tx_blob
result.desc: A hex representation of the signed transaction. This result can vary between calls even if supplied the same parameters.

command.name: static_path_find
command.desc: Finds a path for a transfer. If you want updates to the path as the state of the ledger changes use find_path instead.

argument.name: source_account
argument.desc: Sender's Stellar address.

argument.name: destination_account
argument.desc: Receiver's Stellar address.

argument.name: destination_amount
argument.desc: Amount sender is trying to send to receiver.

result.name: alternatives
result.desc: List of path choices.

result.name: source_amount
result.desc: The cost of this path for the source account.

result.name: paths_computed
result.desc: The path to include in the payment transaction.

result.name: destination_currencies
result.desc: List of currencies this destination can hold.

command.name: Payment
command.desc: Submit a payment transaction.

argument.name: TransactionType
argument.desc: Set to "Payment".

argument.name: Account
argument.desc: The account sending the payment.

argument.name: Destination
argument.desc: The account receiving the payment.

argument.name: Amount
argument.desc: The amount to send. This is either a number of microstellars (if sending STR) or a {value,currency,issuer} triplet for sending a credit.

argument.name: Fee
argument.desc: Set the transaction fee in microstellars that is attached to this transaction. If the fee isn't specified it will be set by the server.

argument.name: Sequence
argument.desc: Set the correct sequence number for the signing account. If the sequence isn't specified it will be set by the server.

argument.name: DestinationTag
argument.desc: Optional tag to associate with the transaction.

argument.name: Paths
argument.desc: List of paths to send through.

command.name: AccountSet
command.desc: Submit an AccountSet transaction. This is used to set various flags of the account entry. You can use it to set the inflation destination of an account.

argument.name: TransactionType
argument.desc: Set to "AccountSet".

argument.name: InflationDest
argument.desc: Change the inflation destination for this account.

argument.name: TransferRate
argument.desc:
Set the transfer rate that this account will charge any time its credit moves from one account to another. The actual rate charged is equivalent to TransferRate/1000000000. For example if some gateway "WizardPay" has sets their TransferRate to 1020000000, the equivalent of 2%. Now Alice wants to send 100 WizardPay USD to Charlie. Alice will need to send 102 WizardPay USD so 100 gets to Charlie and 2 is essentially returned to "WizardPay" to pay the credit transfer fee.

Set the TransferRate to 1000000000 for no fee to move credit. You can't set the TransferRate below 1000000000.

argument.name: SetFlag
argument.desc:
Set to one of the following values:
  • 1- Require Destination tag flag. This flag is a hint to the client that this account only wants transactions with a destination tag.
  • 2- Require Auth flag. If this flag is set then no one can hold credit from this account without prior authorization from this account. This setting is useful for gateways that need to KYC any that holds credit from them.
  • 4- Disable Master key flag. If this flag is set then the master secret key will not be used to sign any transactions. Account can only be accessed using the regular key (designated with a SetRegularKey transaction). This flag can then only be cleared by the regular key.
    If master key is disabled and regular key is lost or invalid, the account will never be able to get a transaction into a ledger anymore. One use case for this is to lock/burn an account and associated STR/credits.

argument.name: ClearFlag
argument.desc:
Set to one of the following values:
  • 1- Require Destination tag flag. This flag is a hint to the client that this account only wants transactions with a destination tag.
  • 2- Require Auth flag. If this flag is set then no one can hold credit from this account without prior authorization from this account. This setting is useful for gateways that need to KYC any that holds credit from them.
  • 4- Disable Master key flag. If this flag is set then the master secret key will not be used to sign any transactions. Account can only be accessed using the regular key (designated with SetRegularKey. This flag can then only be cleared by the regular key.
    If master key is disabled and regular key is lost or invalid, the account will never be able to get a transaction into a ledger anymore. One use case for this is to lock/burn an account and associated STR/credits.

argument.name: Fee
argument.desc: Set the transaction fee in microstellars that is attached to this transaction. If the fee isn't specified it will be set by the server.

argument.name: Sequence
argument.desc: Set the correct sequence number for the signing account. If the sequence isn't specified it will be set by the server.

command.name: SetRegularKey
command.desc: Use to set or clear this account's regular key. The regular key can be used to sign transactions instead of the master secret key. This is useful since you can change the regular key if need be without recreating the whole account. A regular key is just a normal key pair that can be generated with create keys or any other Stellar account key generator. The master key can also be disabled using AccountSet.

argument.name: TransactionType
argument.desc: Should be set "SetRegularKey".

argument.name: RegularKey
argument.desc: If provided will change the regular key to this new value. If not provided it will clear the regular key so only the master key can sign again.

argument.name: Fee
argument.desc: Set the transaction fee in microstellars that is attached to this transaction. If the fee isn't specified it will be set by the server.

argument.name: Sequence
argument.desc: Set the correct sequence number for the signing account. If the sequence isn't specified it will be set by the server.

command.name: OfferCreate
command.desc: Add an offer to the distributed order book. Offers are commitments by the offerer to trade a certain amount of one currency for another. Offers can be partially taken. Creating an offer might result in an immediate trade if the created offer crosses with an existing one.

argument.name: TransactionType
argument.desc: Set to "OfferCreate".

argument.name: Account
argument.desc: The account creating the offer.

argument.name: TakerGets
argument.desc: This is what the account taking the offer will get. It is what the offer creator is agreeing to pay.

argument.name: TakerPays
argument.desc: This is what the offer creator will get and what the offer taker will pay.

argument.name: OfferSequence
argument.desc: The sequence number of a previous offer. If specified the previous offer will be replaced with this one.

argument.name: Fee
argument.desc: Set the transaction fee in microstellars that is attached to this transaction. If the fee isn't specified it will be set by the server.

argument.name: Sequence
argument.desc: Set the correct sequence number for the signing account. If the sequence isn't specified it will be set by the server.

command.name: OfferCancel
command.desc: Cancels an offer this account has made. The sequence number for an offer can be obtained through account_offers or recorded when the offer was first created.

argument.name: TransactionType
argument.desc: Set to "OfferCancel".

argument.name: Account
argument.desc: The account canceling the offer.

argument.name: OfferSequence
argument.desc: The sequence number of the offer to cancel.

argument.name: Fee
argument.desc: Set the transaction fee in microstellars that is attached to this transaction. If the fee isn't specified it will be set by the server.

argument.name: Sequence
argument.desc: Set the correct sequence number for the signing account. If the sequence isn't specified it will be set by the server.

command.name: TrustSet
command.desc:
Creates a trust line allowing the source account account to hold credits from another account up to a specified limit.

It is recommended that you set the NoRipple flag (131072). To delete a trust line, set the LimitAmount value to 0 and use the ClearNoRipple (262144) flag (when NoRipple flag is set).

argument.name: TransactionType
argument.desc: Set to "TrustSet".

argument.name: Account
argument.desc: The account extending trust.

argument.name: LimitAmount
argument.desc: An amount triplet specifying the currency code, credit amount limit, and credit issuer of this trust line. Transactions that cause the account to hold more credits than specified in this amount will fail. For most use cases, setting an extremely large trust limit such is recommended.

argument.name: Fee
argument.desc: Set the transaction fee in microstellars that is attached to this transaction. If the fee isn't specified it will be set by the server.

argument.name: Flags
argument.desc:
Allows you to change settings of this line. NoRipple is recommended and ClearNoRipple flags is required to cancel the trust line. Possible bit flags are:
  • tfSetAuth (0x00010000; 65536) | Used by a gateway account to authorize a target account to receive credits issued by this account.
  • tfSetNoRipple (0x00020000; 131072) | Sets the NoRipple flag to prevent rippling through this trust line. Disabling rippling is highly recommended.
  • tfClearNoRipple (0x00040000; 262144) | Clears NoRipple flag if set and allows deleting of this trust line. Necessary when deleting a trust line with the NoRipple flag active.

argument.name: Sequence
argument.desc: Set the correct sequence number for the signing account. If the sequence isn't specified it will be set by the server.

command.name: AccountMerge
command.desc:
An account merge transaction.

Balances are moved to the destination account.

Note that the destination account's trust lines must be able to accomodate for the updated balances:

  • balance must be positive
  • resulting balance must not be over limit
  • destination must be authorized if the source account was authorized with a gateway.

argument.name: TransactionType
argument.desc: Set to "AccountMerge".

argument.name: Account
argument.desc: The source account to merge.

argument.name: Destination
argument.desc: The account to merge the source account into.

command.name: submit
command.desc: Submits a transaction to the network. The transaction can be submitted unsigned if you include your secret key and stellard will sign it for you.

argument.name: secret
argument.desc: The signer's secret key. Do not provide this field to untrusted servers. Required if submitting with tx_json parameter.

argument.name: tx_json
argument.desc: This is the JSON representation of the transaction to submit. See the specific transactions for details.

argument.name: tx_blob
argument.desc: This is a signed and serialized transaction. Obtain a signed transaction blob by either signing the transaction yourself using the javascript-lib, or by calling the sign command first with the transaction's details. Use this version if you don't want to expose your secret key to stellard.

command.name: subscribe
command.desc:
Listen to events. If you are using websocket stellard will send you messages when an event of the type you are listening to happens. You can also specify a URL that is called when an event happens if you are not listening on websocket.

See unsubscribe for when you want to stop the event stream.

argument.name: streams
argument.desc:
An array of stream names you want events on. Possible streams:
  • ledger - ledger close events
  • transactions - sends a message for every transaction that makes it into a closed ledger.
  • transactions_rt - sends a message immediately when a this stellard sees a transaction and again when the transaction makes it into the ledger.
  • server - sends messages about server status and network connectivity.

argument.name: accounts
argument.desc: An array of accountIDs you want events on. Will subscribe you to transaction streams for the given accounts.

argument.name: accounts_rt
argument.desc: An array of accountIDs you want events on. Sends a message immediately when stellard sees a transaction effecting one of these accounts and again if the transaction is included in the ledger.

argument.name: books
argument.desc:
An array of objects specifying an order books to listen to. Stellard will send a message any time one of the specified order books change. Order book object is:
  • taker_gets- type of currency and issuer the taker of these offers will get.
  • taker_pays- type of currency and issuer the taker of these offers will pay.
  • both- if set to true will send you events for both sides of the order book.
  • snapshot- if set to true will send you the current state of the order book before it starts streaming the changes.
Example: { "taker_gets" : { "currency": "USD", "issuer" : address }, "taker_pays" : { "currency": "BTC", "issuer" : address }, "snapshot" : "true" , "both" : "true" }

argument.name: url
argument.desc: Specifies a URL that stellard will post messages to via JSON-RPC when your specified events happen. This parameter is required if you're using the JSON-RPC endpoint. Each message will come with a sequentially increasing sequence number starting with 1. A gap in these numbers indicates a lost message. Currently, only http is supported and hosts must be specified by IP address.

argument.name: url_username
argument.desc: Optional username for JSON-RPC authentication.

argument.name: url_password
argument.desc: Optional password for JSON-RPC authentication.

result.name: Stream type 'server'
result.desc:
A Returned message from a subscribe of the "server" stream".
  • type - "serverStatus"
  • load_base - the minimum/normal load factor (256)
  • load_factor - This value reflects the load the stellard node is under.
  • server_status/li>
  • random - a random value generated for this event

result.name: Stream type 'ledger'
result.desc:
A Returned message from a subscribe of the "server" stream". Issued once the ledger is validated, for each ledger close.
  • type - "ledgerClosed"
  • txn_count - number of transactions that will be published in this ledger.
  • reserve_base - minimum reserve balance for an account to be created with.
  • reserve_inc - For each "entry" that corresponds to your account (eg. offers or trust lines), your minimum reserver increments by this amount
  • fee_base - The "base" fee is the cost to send a reference transaction under no load, expressed in millionths of one STR.
  • fee_ref - The units used to scale the fee base.

result.name: Stream type 'transactions'
result.desc:
A Returned message from a subscribe of the "server" stream".
  • type - "transaction"
  • transaction - Transaction information
  • meta - Includes "AffectedNodes" for this transaction.

command.name: tx
command.desc: Get details of a specific transaction.

argument.name: transaction
argument.desc: Index (hash) of the transaction to fetch.

argument.name: binary
argument.desc: If true, will return the binary representation of this transaction.

command.name: tx_history
command.desc: Returns the last N transactions starting from the given index. Returns from latest to earliest. N is set by stellard.

argument.name: startIndex
argument.desc: Index to start returning transactions from.

command.name: unsubscribe
command.desc: Unsubscribe from events that were previously subscribed to. See subscribe for a list of possible events. To unsubscribe from events previously subscribed to just specify them in the same way.
